main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 23 June 1949 at Fort Devens, Massachusetts. The observer, an Army officer, witnessed a disc-shaped object with a white glow tinged with red, moving in a circular manner and then disappearing out of sight. The sighting lasted 2-3 seconds with no sound or trail observed.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-shaped with a white glow tinged with red, resembling a plate.
It was estimated to be at an altitude of 45-50 degrees and was seen traveling in a circular motion from southeast to west.
No sound, odor, or trail was detected from the object, and it disappeared out of sight 'like a light.'
The observer was an Army officer, and it was noted that the intelligence of the individual was above average and character above reproach.
The observer did not wear glasses, and the object was viewed through an automobile window.
sighted object: disc-shaped object with a white glow tinged with red
